reviewText: Like this dvd as I enjoy all of Leslie's pgms. HOWEVER, I found some of the moves in the boosts and the pace awkward. They just didn't flow right.As usual, Leslie is very upbeat and encouraging. I love that about her!I prefer The Big Burn over this one.

reviewText: I think Leslie is a great fitness instructor. She is good at explaining very basic moves that will give you a great work out. She is happy, bubbly, and stresses the importantance of moving your body and being healthy. Like other videos of Leslie's, I like that the people exercising in the tape are real people, they are not models. I found this very encouraging. You dont need a lot of room and you don't need any equipment. I would keep a little water by you, though, because I think this is a great, short work out!I like using it in combination with the other two videos that come in the set ( if you are buying the complete set): Walk and Kick, Power Mile. ( Walk and Jog comes with these two)Leslie is so encouraging. This is a good tape for someone who wants to get back into exercising or who has never had a fitness program before. I feel it is also good for someone who wants to add variety to their work out and is already in good shape. It really gets your heart beating fast and makes you sweat but its a nice short workout. I give this five stars! You will have a great time.
summary: This will get your heart pumping & coming back for more!

reviewText: I'm a regular exerciser, and I've always viewed Leslie Sansone as being more for beginners.  I do have one of her other videos, WATP for Abs, 3 Miles, that I like to use when I want a longer, lower intensity, "no-brainer" workout, but I wasn't sure if Leslie could produce a shorter routine that would still provide the intensity I'd want.  After reading so many great reviews of Walk and Jog, I decided to take a chance on it, and I'm so glad that I did!Walk and Jog is basically an interval workout in which Leslie alternates segments of her traditional walking moves with gentle jogging.  The workout begins with about a 6-minute warm-up which quickly got my heart rate into my target zone and kept it there.  Leslie then introduces the intervals, first by upping the pace of the walk for 3 minutes, then by transitioning to 2 minutes of jogging.  Again, it is a very light, fairly low-impact jog that you can easily tailor to your desired intensity level.  During the jogging intervals, Leslie incorportates other moves such as front kicks, corner kicks, and leg swings (a pendulum move).  There are a lot of kicks and knee lifts throughout the walking segments as well, which I really liked, as I these provide some extra core work.  Also, Leslie increasingly adds arm movements to up the intensity.  There are a total of 4 intervals, and then the workout ends with a 4-minute aerobic cool-down, bringing the total time in at just under 32 minutes.I found the intensity level of this workout to be exactly what I was looking for, as I stayed in my target heart rate zone virtually the entire time, including the warm-up and cool-down.  The workout could be easily modified to suit your own personal intensity level--one of Leslie's four background exercisers keeps it low impact the entire time, but you could also add additional arm movements or even light weights if you were looking to up the intensity.  Leslie says that the workout is equivalent of 2.5 miles, and the time really does fly by--I couldn't believe it when she said we were halfway through.  Finally, not only was this workout effective, but it was fun too!  I especially enjoyed the jogging variations, and since I don't like high-impact work, I loved that these segments were kept pretty soft and low (yet still intense!).  I think this video would be suitable for a wide range of exercisers, and I highly recommend it.
summary: A great mid-intensity, mid-length workout appropriate for a wide range of exercisers

reviewText: I do like this workout, it's 2 1/2 miles in 30 minutes and you have walking intervals mixed with jogging intervals.  There is one walker who does not jog but keeps to the low impact the entire time so if you can't do it at first you can work your way into it, which I liked.  I feel I get a great workout in 30 minutes, which I can pretty much fit in anytime, and I really work up a sweat.This would be 5 stars if the quality of the dvd was better.  The quality is kind of poor on my dvd, some of the walkers look kind of blurry at times, and the low impact walker (Mary Kay?) is wearing a red top which is blurry a LOT of the time.  Like they didn't quite get the colors right on the dvd.Although the quality issue is a bit distracting, overall it is a great addition to my at home rotation.

reviewText: The WATP's newest addition Walk/jog is one of the more difficult ones that I have done.  I was breaking a sweat the whole time and even felt a little awkward doing the jogging sections.  But, when I felt odd I just went back to the low impact moves and kept right on moving.  I thought  the video was fun but I really enjoyed the Walk/Kick one better.  I do think, however, that if you are a Leslie fan you should own this video.  It is good, but if you have never done one of her videos before I would suggest the WATP originals to become familiar with her pace and moves, but if you are looking for a new video to add to your collection I suggest this one.  It was good.

reviewText: I've done this workout twice so far, and I highly recommend it to those who want to add some variety to their Walk at Home collection!It's a 30 minute (2 miles) walk with her classic knee-lift, side-steps & kicks routine with added moves to keep it interesting!  In leading up to the intense section, you begin walking back and forth.  Then you start a gentle jog back and forth.  Bouncy kicks are usually next.  A new move is where you swing your leg from side to side.  It takes me a second to get it down, but it's fun!  The next time you do this particular move, you swing your arms from side to side alongside..side.Anyway!  These jogging segments last 2 minutes and you perform them 4 times throughout the DVD.You're bound to recognize some or all of the faces she's brought with her & the time goes by in a flash!I have no problem motivating myself to pop this in the DVD player.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Leslie Sansone's "Walk and Jog" is thirty minutes of a mixture of low impact and high impact exercising. It combines the four basic steps that Leslie always uses - walking in place, side steps, knee lifts, and kicking - with four jogging intervals. For those who feel the jogging intervals are too much, there is one person who does a walking routine instead of jogging so you can follow her if you want to. According to Leslie, the workout is equivalent to a 2  mile walk, although the pedometer I wore said two miles at the end of the program.While I'm a huge Leslie Sansone fan and have been doing her one and two mile walks for some time, I was afraid "Walk and Jog" would be a little too intense an exercise routine for me. I was pleasantly surprised. The jogging intervals are nicely spaced apart and combine jogging back and forth with either kicks or leg swings. The transition from walking to jogging is smoothly done - you walk up two and back two and gradually turn that into jogging back and forth. When the jogging interval is done, you jog forward and backward gradually turning the jogging back into walking up two and back two. The kicks and side swings done during the jogging interval add a lot of fun to the routine. The jogging intervals are not as varied as I would have liked, but they last just long enough. I did vary some of the routine (lunges) when I thought it was more than I could handle. As always, Leslie adds in arm movements throughout the routine for a total body workout.I'm a huge Leslie fan, but I'll be the first to admit her exercise DVD's aren't always perfect. She can be off in her count, she sometimes tells you to do the wrong thing (for example, she says to kick when she means to do knee lifts), and her advise on how to hydrate before exercising takes place far too late in the DVD. However, one of the reasons I like Leslie's exercise routines is because of the very fact that she can be a bit goofy. I'd much rather do an exercise DVD hosted by someone who is a little unpolished, it gives me hope since I can be a little uncoordinated.I really enjoy exercising with "Walk and Jog".
Title: N/A

reviewText: 2.5 miles in 30 minutes? Fantastic. The energy level is high and the enthusiasm is infectious. Leslie's "Sister in Sweat," Mary Kay, is there modifying for those who want more of a low-intensity workout (compensating by lower intensity in her steps and higher intensity in the kicks...some of the other reviewers need to really watch the routine and listen to what she's saying). The jogging and front/side kicks are metabolism boosters without causing this reviewer any pain. but your mileage may vary. Really good workout for those who want to graduate from a stroll in the park. Leslie workout "patter" is less intrusive than in other workouts.

reviewText: Wow. I really like this. This is my second Leslie video. The first one I tried is the 4 Fast Miles. LOVE that one for sure but don't always have an hour so I was looking for something shorter but as intense. This is it! Warm up is quick and gentle, there are 4 short jogs that don't "kill" you. She keeps you so entertained and doing different movements, it's brainless but not boring.Leslie makes me laugh. She's so goofy but its a fun-goofy. She's the kind of person you'd want to be friends with so I don't find it distracting. She's having fun. She truly cares about 'that person on the other side of the camera'.Great workout. Like I said in the title. You will sweat buckets but you won't be so out of breath that you can't keep up. I think beginners and moderate exercisers can do this. I sweat for another 20-30 minutes after the cool down.Everyone has time and the energy for this workout. Go ahead and get it. You won't be sorry.
summary: Oh my! Lots of sweat! Not out of breath.

reviewText: I have been doing Leslie's walking videos for months now and they have really helped me to slim down and get fit. I think it is mostly because the moves are so simple, and although her voice can be annoying she is really motivating.Things I Liked- This video bumps up the intensity from her just walking videos by interspersing 2 minute periods of light jogging with walking.  The light jogging movements include low quick kicks, a pendulum move and of course, jogging.  The walking portions entailed knee lifts, kicks, marching and side steps. The time just seems to fly by when you are doing this DVD.Also she does not talk as much to the other people as she does in other videos (I often found the cheesy conversations annoying.)Addtionally, if you are not ready to do the jogging segments, there is a woman who demonstrates a low impact modified version throughout.Things I Did Not Like- I wish it could have been longer. Maybe she will make a longer one in the future. This workout clocks in about 2.5 miles in 30 minutes, and I usually like to do a longer workout.Overall, this is an excellent buy and a great addition to your exercise DVD collection.
summary: This is a great workout to take it to the next level...

reviewText: I tried this workout for the first time today and absolutely love it.  I've used Leslie's 2 mile video and wanted something new to add some variety to my exercise.  However, I wasn't ready for a longer workout like the 3 mile.  This workout is still only 30 minutes, but is a little more intense than her 2 mile walk with intervals of jogging.  There are other fun moves as well that keep the workout interesting.  As a lifelong couch potato I never imagined myself jogging, but it was easy interspersed with the walking.  I've never really enjoyed exercise and I usually watch the clock to figure out when the workout's going to be over, but at the end of this one I was actually having so much fun I wished it would last a little longer.  I highly recommend this DVD.

reviewText: A pretty strong workout.  Leslie does interval training with this workout.  She starts with a slow walk and works her way into a jog both moving and stationary and back to a walk.  The only thing I didn't like about this one is instead of just jogging during that interval she does kicks and leg swings.  I would have just loved to jog more and I find it kind of hard to transition into those moves after the jog motion.  If you have any kinds of knee problems I would not recomend the higher impact of this one..

reviewText: I liked this workout alot. Leslie uses all her mainstay moves, plus mild jog intervals. What I didn't like about the workout, is Mary Kay! She is supposed to be doing the low impact level, but in EVERY workout video I see her in, she is moving at a higher pace and level than anybody else, including Leslie, herself!!! Leslie even remarks in this video that Mary Kay is sweating more than her, and is it any wonder, considering the pace she keeps! I also don't care for the low kick and skip segments that Leslie does (something, I'll never be able to do), although, younger, more advanced students, might find this a plus. Overall I do like the workout. It really works well for all levels, if you go at your own pace, and don't pay much attention to Mary Kay! She is inappropriate as the low impact instuctor. I hope Leslie continues to do more jogging workouts geared for all levels.

reviewText: I had been using Leslie's 2 and 3 mile walking videos when I decided I wanted something a little more intense, but without the added time.  This video was perfect for that.  It lasts 30 minutes (she tells you at the end it is approximately a 2.5 mile walk/jog).  She starts off with a warm-up and uses her basic walking moves.  This video does not include weights, but instead she eases you into 4 "jogging" intervals.  I have never been a runner, but this video has made me think I may be able to try some day in the future.  It is definitely more intense than some of her walking videos, but the jogging isn't forced or over-tiring on an intermediate walker.  Instead, she eases you in to the intervals.  As well, you can choose to walk during those intervals and I imagine the intensity there is pretty close.This is one of my new favorites when I am looking for something quick and intense.  Like all of Leslie's videos, you can adjust it to your fitness level not only by doing half movements or walking instead of the more difficult moves, but also you could choose to jog in place at a light pace barely lifting your feet or when you are ready get more intense and exaggerate your jogging movements for a better workout.  Leslie's videos may be known for those totally out of shape looking to get back into shape, but I find that they can still be quite intense even after working out for several months.  This workout keeps me going and I love the way I feel afterwards.  I would recommend it to those familiar with Leslie's videos looking for a step up, or those who consider themselves in good shape already looking to try a little jogging.
summary: Great workout for the intermediate walker
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've been using this DVD and the 4 mile Super Challenge for 2 1/2 weeks and have already lost 3 lbs.  This is a great workout because it only takes 30 minutes, but the jogging intervals keep it very intense and high calorie burning.  As with many fitness instructors, Leslie Sansone is encouraging and chatty, but I find her personable and not annoying.  She is occasionally off cue, but since the steps are basic, it is easy to follow even if you end up on a different foot than she is.Regarding some other reviews that remark on Mary Kay's high kicks (Mary Kay leads a low impact version in case the jogging becomes too high impact), if you simply listen to the cues, you can hear that Mary Kay is showing a low IMPACT, not low INTENSITY version.  The point is to avoid the impact while keeping the intensity and pace really high to burn tons of calories.  If you follow Mary Kay, you should be sweaty and kicking high!!  Overall, a great workout, especially in just 30 minutes!

reviewText: I only own two of Ms. Sansone's DVD's this title and the "Four Mile Super Challenge." Though I now use both rarely this title does not have an edge over the super challenge in my opinion unless one can only spare a half hour and/or desires a 2.5 mile run/walk.The familiar moves such as knee lifts, turns, side to side movements are all featured. The major difference in this collection are the minute fifty average jogging intervals, around every seven minutes.I believe this program is great for serious Sansone devotees, people unsure if they can up their walking pace or consumers such as myself who didn't know their running/jogging pace time when they  took their first steps towards running as serious exercise.A solid DVD and great for the beginner.
summary: New to running? Short on time?

reviewText: Walk and Jog is a 30 minute walking workout with jogging intervals thrown in.  Perfect for those looking to add a little oomph and challenge to their walking routines.This didn't quite work for me though, mainly because I am not a jogger, or a fan of high impact to begin with, but that's my own issue.  I did appreciate the fact that Leslie had a low impact modifier (Mary Kay), I was able to follow her otherwise I would have been completely lost.Even so, this workout was a bit frustrating for me, and a bit hard to follow. The pace was almost manic, very fast which is well...understandable for a jogging workout.  Another reviewer hit it on the head, it just didn't flow very well.Luckily for me, this routine is on one of my compilation DVDs so I didn't purchase on it's own.  I would definitely recommend this for those who like higher impact moves, they look like fun.  I have to stay away from high impact though, or keep it very limited.  My knees talk back to me, plus I have a damaged achilles tendon so I need to be careful.This looks like a hit with many others though so if you like a little walking and a little jogging, give this a try!
